==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=无名}}

===Etymology===
Literally, ''lacking a name or reputation''.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=wúmíng
|c=mou4 ming4
|h=pfs=vù-miàng
|mn=bû-bêng/qz,xm:bô-miâ
|cat=a
}}

===Adjective===
{{zh-noun}}

# {{lb|zh|attributive}} [[anonymous]]; [[nameless]]
# [[unknown]]; [[unnotable]]; [[unremarkable]]
# [[unexplainable]]; [[inexplicable]]

===Derived terms===
{{zh-der|無名火|無名氏|無名小卒|無名英雄|無名之輩|無名指}}

----

==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|む|めい|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=むめい}} compound {{m|zh|無名|tr=mju mjieng|lit=not have + name}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|むめい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|むめい}}

# [[namelessness]], [[anonymity]]
# [[lack]] of [[fame]], [[unnotability]]

====Usage notes====
Often used [[attributively]] to modify other nouns, using the particle {{m|ja|の|tr=no}}.
* {{ja-usex|'''無名'''の手紙、'''無名'''の新人|'''むめい''' の てがみ、 '''むめい''' の しんじん|a '''nameless''' (unsigned) letter; a '''nameless''' (unknown, not famous) new person}}
